nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: Middle school brings new routines: lockers, new teachers, and a feed full of other people's highlights.

nodes.speaker: Player
nodes.text: It’s hard not to compare. Everyone seems to have a highlight-reel.

choices.text: Take a break from the feed for a day.
Post something too and watch reactions.
Message a friend and ask how they really feel.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: A break helps — the noise quiets and you breathe a bit easier.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: Replies come and go. Validation fades, but you learn what posting really costs.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: Your friend admits they feel the same. You both decide to limit scrolling together.

nodes.speaker: Player
nodes.text: Online life is edited. Real talks with friends help more than feeds.
